sense.name: (baseball) a score made by a runner touching all four bases safely.
sense.examples: The Yankees scored 3 runs in the bottom of the 9th. Their first run came in the 3rd inning.

sense.name: The act of testing something.
sense.examples: In the trials, each run was completed separately. He called each mouse a new run.

sense.name: The act of physically running (a race).
sense.examples: She broke the record for the run yesterday. His daily run keeps him fit. He broke into a run.

sense.name: An unbroken sequence of events.
sense.examples: We had a run of bad luck. Nicklaus had a run of birdies. The play had a long run on Broadway. The team enjoyed a brief run of victories.

sense.name: (American football) a play in which the player attempts to carry the ball.
sense.examples: The defensive line braced to stop the run. The coach puts a great emphasis on the run.

sense.name: A trip or jaunt.
sense.examples: We made a short run into town for groceries. The ship made its run in record time.

sense.name: A continuous period of production.
sense.examples: The assembly line was on a 12-hour run. AWe had a daily run of 100,000 gallons of paint.

sense.name: Unrestricted freedom to use something.
sense.examples: He has the run of the house. She basically has the run of the company offices.

sense.name: A small stream or pouring forth of a fluid.
sense.examples: Go down to the run and draw some water. The mountain has many small runs.

sense.name: A race between candidates for elective office.
sense.examples: I managed his run for governor. He is raising money for a Senate run.

sense.name: A row of unravelled stiches.
sense.examples: The is a run in that sweater. She got a run in her stocking.
